title: Show Chunk Borders in Minecraft: Tutorial for Bedrock & Java

steps.title: Launch your world in Minecraft Java Edition.
steps.content: Launch your world in Minecraft Java Edition. You can use a keyboard shortcut to reveal a multicolored wireframe border around the chunks. Knowing the location of chunks can help you survive and become a better player .

steps.title: Press F3+G.
steps.content: Press F3 + G . Chunk borders will appear instantly. [3] X Research source You'll see a message at the bottom-left corner of your screen: Chunk borders: shown . [4] X Research source

steps.title: View your chunk borders.
steps.content: View your chunk borders. The border will only appear around the current chunk you're standing in. As you move to another chunk, the border will move with you. [5] X Research source To turn off borders, press F3 + G again.

steps.title: Launch your world in Minecraft Bedrock Edition.
steps.content: Launch your world in Minecraft Bedrock Edition. Since there is no official tool to see chunk borders on Minecraft Bedrock Edition, you'll need to use some math with your coordinates.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings. Press ESC if you're using a keyboard or Start if you're using a controller.

steps.title: Click Game.
steps.content: Click Game . This will be under the World header on the left side. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Show Coordinates.
steps.content: Click Show Coordinates . Make sure this option is toggled on. This will be underneath the World Options header. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Determine your location.
steps.content: Determine your location . Coordinates in Minecraft display your world position in the format (X, Y, Z). This represents how far you are from the world origin. [8] X Research source If either of the X or Z coordinates are divisible by 16 (ex: 16, 32, 48â€¦), you're at the edge of a chunk. [9] X Research source If both X and Z are divisible by 16, you're in the northwest corner of the chunk. You can use these coordinates to pinpoint ores such as gold and iron . You could even use chunk borders to find a perfect location for a house .
